item.title: Por la Tierra, la Producción y contra todas las Injusticias (Partido Comunista Revolucionario)
item.description: Con cánticos y consignas por la reforma agraria, la lucha de las mujeres campesinas y las juventudes, miles y miles de campesinos y campesinas e integrantes de pueblos indígenas fueron llegando a la capital paraguaya desde lo profundo de los territorios del país guaraní. Entusiasmo, orgullo y decisión política para caminar junto a distintos sectores…

item.title: Update on the case of the journalist Ertan Çıta – The Red Herald (Red Herald)
item.description: Yeni Demokrasi reports that the Ankara 4th High Criminal Court has rejected the objection of the lawyer of their journalist Ertan Çıta to the decision to froze his assets, which will be brought to the Constitutional Court.

item.title: US approves new delivery of bombs and war planes to Israel amid protests – The Red Herald (Red Herald)
item.description: The Land Day, Yom-al-Ard, was celebrated for the 48th time in Palestine and among the Palestinian diaspora all over the world on the 30th of March to commemorate protests against Israel confiscating 2,000 hectares of Palestinian lands in 1976

item.title: Συγκέντρωση των εργαζομένων της ΛΑΡΚΟ στο υπουργείο Οικονομικών (Resistance in the neighbourhood)
60 anos do golpe de 64: O Movimento Camponês combativo e a ameaça ao latifúndio - A Nova Democracia (A Nova Democracia)
item.description: Nas vésperas do golpe de 1964, a questão agrária era a mais urgente no Brasil. O movimento camponês sacudia o país proclamando por intermédio das Ligas Camponesas a exigência da “reforma agrária na lei ou na marra”, do fim da concentração de terras.

item.title: Turkey: The polls open in the local elections – The Red Herald (Red Herald)
item.description: The local elections in Turkey are held today. Since the opening of the polls, grave violations of the bourgeois ideals of ”free” elections have been reported – electoral observes have been forced away from the booths, people vote with ballots they have brought with them and in large groups, and in Kurdish provinces soldiers and police have been brought to the booths in uniform and carrying weapons, which is a violation of the electoral laws.
